bug.author: rosgluk
bug.summary: fresh baremetal install fails to start tf-job-operator - can't find CRD
bug.description:
Hi, I'm trying to install Kubeflow 0.6rc0 and tf-job-operator is not taking off k8s client v1.15.0 k8s server v1.14.3 baremetal - kubespray+metallb kfctl is compiled from fresh master branch used unmodified kfctl_existing_arrikto.0.6.yaml and pod with tf-job-operator is in CrashLoopBackOff, trying to find CRD and fails, but it looks like CRD is there... can someone please point where to look to fix it? <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
kubectl get pods -n kubeflow -> ... tf-job-operator-79cbfd6dbc-2r4s9 0/1 CrashLoopBackOff 13 46m <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
kubectl describe pod tf-job-operator-79cbfd6dbc-2r4s9 -n kubeflow -> Name: tf-job-operator-79cbfd6dbc-2r4s9 Namespace: kubeflow ... Environment: MY_POD_NAMESPACE: kubeflow (v1:metadata.namespace) MY_POD_NAME: tf-job-operator-79cbfd6dbc-2r4s9 (v1:metadata.name) Mounts: /etc/config from config-volume (rw) /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount from tf-job-operator-token-n5npl (ro) Conditions: Type Status Initialized True Ready False ContainersReady False PodScheduled True ... Type Reason Age From Message <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Normal Scheduled 47m default-scheduler Successfully assigned kubeflow/tf-job-operator-79cbfd6dbc-2r4s9 to node2 Normal Pulled 45m (x5 over 47m) kubelet, node2 Container image "gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/tf_operator:v0.6.0.rc0" already present on machine Normal Created 45m (x5 over 47m) kubelet, node2 Created container tf-job-operator Normal Started 45m (x5 over 47m) kubelet, node2 Started container tf-job-operator Warning BackOff 117s (x211 over 47m) kubelet, node2 Back-off restarting failed container <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
kubectl logs tf-job-operator-79cbfd6dbc-2r4s9 -n kubeflow -> {"filename":"app/server.go:75","level":"info","msg":"EnvKubeflowNamespace not set, use default namespace","time":"2019-07-17T12:17:05Z"} {"filename":"app/server.go:79","level":"info","msg":"Using cluster scoped operator","time":"2019-07-17T12:17:05Z"} {"filename":"app/server.go:85","level":"info","msg":"[API Version: v1 Version: v0.1.0-alpha Git SHA: Not provided. Go Version: go1.12 Go OS/Arch: linux/amd64]","time":"2019-07-17T12:17:05Z"} W0717 12:17:05.840732 1 client_config.go:552] Neither --kubeconfig nor --master was specified. Using the inClusterConfig. This might not work. {"filename":"tf-operator.v1/main.go:40","level":"info","msg":"Setting up client for monitoring on port: 8443","time":"2019-07-17T12:17:05Z"} {"filename":"app/server.go:209","level":"error","msg":"the server could not find the requested resource (get tfjobs.kubeflow.org)","time":"2019-07-17T12:17:05Z"} {"filename":"app/server.go:109","level":"info","msg":"CRD doesn't exist. Exiting","time":"2019-07-17T12:17:05Z"} <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
kubectl describe crd tfjobs.kubeflow.org -> Name: tfjobs.kubeflow.org Namespace: Labels: app.kubernetes.io/deploy-manager=ksonnet ksonnet.io/component=tf-job-operator Annotations: ksonnet.io/managed: {"pristine":"H4sI... kubecfg.ksonnet.io/garbage-collect-tag: gc-tag API Version: apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1 ... Version: v1beta1 Versions: Name: v1beta1 Served: true Storage: true Name: v1beta2 Served: true Storage: false Status: Accepted Names: Kind: TFJob List Kind: TFJobList Plural: tfjobs Singular: tfjob Conditions: Last Transition Time: 2019-07-06T11:40:46Z Message: no conflicts found Reason: NoConflicts Status: True Type: NamesAccepted Last Transition Time: Message: the initial names have been accepted Reason: InitialNamesAccepted Status: True Type: Established Stored Versions: v1beta1 <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.79. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Something looks wrong with your TFJob install. The version should be v1 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/eeaff416be9d273356bb55e2d823bb797b950ba4/tf-training/tf-job-operator/base/crd.yaml#L44>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/eeaff416be9d273356bb55e2d823bb797b950ba4/tf-training/tf-job-operator/base/crd.yaml#L44</denchmark-link>
But it looks like you have v1beta1 installed. It also looks like the CRD was installed via ksonnet which indicates an install from a version previous to 0.6.
I would suggest deleted the CRD and reinstalling it.
Are you trying to install 0.6 on a cluster you had previously installed Kubeflow on?

Hi jlewi, thanks for your reply
Are you trying to install 0.6 on a cluster you had previously installed Kubeflow on?
yes, was trying to install 0.5.1 there before and removed with kfctl delete all -V kfctl was of previous precompiled version then probably left some residual <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
the following helped: cd ${KFAPP} # where kfcluster configs are kubectl delete crd tfjobs.kubeflow.org kubectl create -f kustomize/tf-job-operator/base/crd.yaml <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
please close this issue
